summary: This is an email from a US Attorney's Office contractor summarizing a WebEx interview with Susan Shelling, a retired court reporter. The interview concerns her verification of her signature and certification on a deposition transcript (likely related to the Epstein case), her work history, and her recognition of names like Dahliah Wiess and Donnie Murrell.

persons.name: Sunny Drescher
persons.role: Contractor for US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS)
persons.context: Sender of the email summarizing the WebEx interview with Susan Shelling.

persons.name: Susan Shelling
persons.context: Interviewed via WebEx regarding her past work, her signature/certification on a deposition transcript (document 3504-009), and her recognition of associated names.

persons.name: Dahliah Wiess
persons.context: Mentioned by Susan Shelling as someone she did a lot of deposition work with.

persons.name: Donnie Murrell
persons.context: Name remembered by Susan Shelling in association with the deposition work.

connections.description: Shelling states she did a lot of deposition work with Dahliah Wiess.
Shelling remembers the name Donnie Murrell from her past work.
Drescher, a contractor for the US Attorney's Office, conducted or summarized a WebEx interview with Shelling.

events.title: WebEx Interview with Susan Shelling
events.description: A WebEx interview was conducted with retired court reporter Susan Shelling regarding her verification of her signature on a deposition transcript and her work history.

events.title: Shelling's Retirement to Florida
events.description: Susan Shelling and her husband retired to Florida in 1993.

events.title: Shelling Returns to Work
events.description: Susan Shelling returned to work as a freelance court reporter in 2001.

events.title: Shelling's Final Retirement
events.description: Susan Shelling retired again in 2015 after 12-13 years working for US Legal Support.

keyFacts: Susan Shelling, a retired court reporter, verified her signature and certification on a deposition transcript labeled 3504-009.
Shelling did a significant amount of deposition work with an attorney or legal professional named Dahliah Wiess.
Shelling remembered the name Donnie Murrell in connection with her past work.
The document is subject to a protective order covering specific paragraphs (7, 8, 9, 10, 15, and 17).
The interview was part of an investigation, likely by the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, into deposition records related to the Epstein case.
